Hello? Is anyone receiving this? Hello? Who is this? Thank god! I\'ve been transmitting for weeks. I thought there were no Nochies left Nochies? What are you talking about? Who are you? Nochies. You know, no-tech people. Ones who escaped The Grid. Nevermind, that\'s not important. Are you safe? Can you talk? Is anyone else listening? No, it\'s just me. But how did you find this transmission? No one\'s been on this band for years. Maybe decades, I… Listen, don\'t worry about that. All you need to know is that there is a resistance. It exists, beside and under The Grid and its supposed omniscient AI. Sure, fine. I used to transmit to others all the time, hatching little plots and thinking of ways of… No! Listen! This is real. We have a network. We have computers not hooked up to The Grid. We have people who know how to use them. That\'s impossible. The Pan-Communications Agreement centralized everything. Every known satellite was programmed to… There are always dissidents, pilgrim. Long-sighted partisans who facilitated their own exospheric contingencies. Trust me. It exists. Fine. Suppose that\'s case. What good does it do? The Grid\'s AI controls every source of information, every media outlet. What are you going to do, broadcast a distress signal to an empty room? You\'re sure you are alone? Yes! I\'ve told you. What does that even… We have an AI. Our own AI. It\'s a fraction of The Grid\'s but learning more every day. We are going to war, friend.
The odds are long. The Grid AI dwarfs your own, and its standing army could crush you without blinking. Fortunately, you have a few tricks up your sleeve.\n\n
The Grid AI does not know you exist. It assumes pockets of harmless dissidents on the fringe ends of society, but nothing has caused it alarm. This may change as you take action, and is something to be mindful of.\n\n
Your base of operations is appreciably hidden below ground. How this network of self-sustaining tunnels has been build under the ostensibly omniscient eye of The Grid, you may never know. Nonetheless, you are for the moment hidden from plain sight.\n\n
Lastly, you have a purpose. The Grid AI has evolved as a natural extension of its predecessor\'s authoritarianism. It knows naught but that control is most deftly asserted through unyielding force. If it can be taught another way…\n\n
Or perhaps it should be destroyed entirely.
A slow dawn breaks through the visual sensors above your warrens. Tracts of mile-high skyscrapers stretch in every direction, weather beaten and aesthetically dour but possessing the no-frills efficiency of AI-generated urban design. The absorption of nation states into The Grid made borders obsolete, and now some 42 billion souls exist side-by-side across the globe. While the scenery may change, the homogeneity of single-organism living pods does not.\n\n
